properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 11 at 8:21PM CST until February 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Aberdeen SD
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, light snow and areas
of blowing snow expected. An Arctic front will move through
the area between 5 and 8 am Wednesday morning bringing an
initial period of snow with very strong north winds gusting up
to 50 mph causing a brief period of very low visibilities.
Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. For the Wind Chill
Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low
as 35 below zero by evening.

* WHERE...Campbell, McPherson, Brown, Walworth and Edmunds
Counties.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 AM to noon CST
Wednesday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from noon Wednesday to
noon CST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The
dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed
skin in as little as 10 minutes.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO NOON CST WEDNESDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON WEDNESDAY TO NOON CST THURSDAY
